- 100 cultural and birding guides trained (50 trained in cultural and 50 trained in birding) -UNDP has partnered with the Ministry of Tourism, Wildlife & Antiquities and the Toro Kingdom to develop a new tourism product named the ‘’Ekyooto Ha Mpango tourism and cultural festival’’ that has focused on facilitating investments within the domestic tourism market, it’s supply chain for economic growth and sustainable job opportunities through investment workshops. Ekyooto Ha mpago cultural tourism festival supported business clinics for youth and growing entrepreneurs, a total of 150 attendees for 3 physical sessions, 1835 online attendance. -UWEC supported to construct the childrens educational Center -UNDP facilitated the 500 trainees with aprons, spatulas, head hats, kitchen towels and 40 movable food carts fitted with 3kg gas cylinders to aid in boosting their businesses. - procurement of 06 Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) and VHF Radio communication to aid in suppressing poaching of wildlife and offer protection of cultural heritages
